text: <a href="../1-Samuel-3-1/" title="1 Samuel 3:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 And the child Samuel ministered unto the LORD before Eli. And the word of the LORD was precious in those days; *there was* no open vision.

<a href="../1-Samuel-3-2/" title="1 Samuel 3:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 And it came to pass at that time, when Eli *was* laid down in his place, and his eyes began to wax dim, *that* he could not see;

<a href="../1-Samuel-3-3/" title="1 Samuel 3:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 And ere the lamp of God went out in the temple of the LORD, where the ark of God *was*, and Samuel was laid down *to sleep*;
<a href="../1-Samuel-3-4/" title="1 Samuel 3:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 That the LORD called Samuel: and he answered, Here *am* I.

<a href="../1-Samuel-3-5/" title="1 Samuel 3:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 And he ran unto Eli, and said, Here *am* I; for thou calledst me. And he said, I called not; lie down again. And he went and lay down.

<a href="../1-Samuel-3-6/" title="1 Samuel 3:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 And the LORD called yet again, Samuel. And Samuel arose and went to Eli, and said, Here *am* I; for thou didst call me. And he answered, I called not, my son; lie down again.
<a href="../1-Samuel-3-7/" title="1 Samuel 3:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 Now Samuel did not yet know the LORD, neither was the word of the LORD yet revealed unto him.

<a href="../1-Samuel-3-8/" title="1 Samuel 3:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 And the LORD called Samuel again the third time. And he arose and went to Eli, and said, Here *am* I; for thou didst call me. And Eli perceived that the LORD had called the child.

<a href="../1-Samuel-3-9/" title="1 Samuel 3:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 Therefore Eli said unto Samuel, Go, lie down: and it shall be, if he call thee, that thou shalt say, Speak, LORD; for thy servant heareth. So Samuel went and lay down in his place.

<a href="../1-Samuel-3-10/" title="1 Samuel 3:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 And the LORD came, and stood, and called as at other times, Samuel, Samuel. Then Samuel answered, Speak; for thy servant heareth.

<a href="../1-Samuel-3-11/" title="1 Samuel 3:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 And the LORD said to Samuel, Behold, I will do a thing in Israel, at which both the ears of every one that heareth it shall tingle.

<a href="../1-Samuel-3-12/" title="1 Samuel 3:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 In that day I will perform against Eli all *things* which I have spoken concerning his house: when I begin, I will also make an end.

<a href="../1-Samuel-3-13/" title="1 Samuel 3:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 For I have told him that I will judge his house for ever for the iniquity which he knoweth; because his sons made themselves vile, and he restrained them not.

<a href="../1-Samuel-3-14/" title="1 Samuel 3:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 And therefore I have sworn unto the house of Eli, that the iniquity of Eli's house shall not be purged with sacrifice nor offering for ever.

<a href="../1-Samuel-3-15/" title="1 Samuel 3:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 And Samuel lay until the morning, and opened the doors of the house of the LORD. And Samuel feared to shew Eli the vision.
<a href="../1-Samuel-3-16/" title="1 Samuel 3:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 Then Eli called Samuel, and said, Samuel, my son. And he answered, Here *am* I.

<a href="../1-Samuel-3-17/" title="1 Samuel 3:17 KJV verse detail"><span id="19" class="versehover">17 And he said, What *is* the thing that *the LORD* hath said unto thee? I pray thee hide *it* not from me: God do so to thee, and more also, if thou hide *any* thing from me of all the things that he said unto thee.

<a href="../1-Samuel-3-18/" title="1 Samuel 3:18 KJV verse detail"><span id="20" class="versehover">18 And Samuel told him every whit, and hid nothing from him. And he said, It *is* the LORD: let him do what seemeth him good.
<a href="../1-Samuel-3-19/" title="1 Samuel 3:19 KJV verse detail"><span id="21" class="versehover">19 And Samuel grew, and the LORD was with him, and did let none of his words fall to the ground.

<a href="../1-Samuel-3-20/" title="1 Samuel 3:20 KJV verse detail"><span id="22" class="versehover">20 And all Israel from Dan even to Beersheba knew that Samuel *was* established *to be* a prophet of the LORD.

<a href="../1-Samuel-3-21/" title="1 Samuel 3:21 KJV verse detail"><span id="23" class="versehover">21 And the LORD appeared again in Shiloh: for the LORD revealed himself to Samuel in Shiloh by the word of the LORD.
